Joint note: introduce a revised method for assessing fisheries status that includes: smoothing the data iteratively to account for stochasticity, and declaring fisheries developing if within a certain number of years after the peak in smoothed catch. also suggest revising the thresholds for the classifications of fishery status based on stock-assessment reference points [vanessa].

Journal: REVIEWS IN FISH BIOLOGY AND FISHERIES
Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
Joint note: Using global data on catch , ex-vessel price (which measures of the economic value of a fishery), and life history characteristics to examine whether higher trophic level organisms are more valuable. Linear regression of trophic level against log transformed price index and revenue index. They also looked at the chronology of global fishery development by trophic level, revenue index, mean annual catch, price index, geometric mean of depth range, and length.a chronology of global development patterns. Maybe a somewhat similar approach to ours? [vanessa].

Journal: CANADIAN JOURNAL OF FISHERIES AND AQUATIC SCIENCES

Joint note: Very similar to our envisioned synthesis approach. Hard to find the exact methodology, which turns out to be embedded in Figure legends. So refer to figures for detailed method descriptions [vanessa]
